Title: Examining the possibility of using programming language with low-cost drones
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 International Conference on Applied Computer and Communication Technologies, ComCom 2017
Affiliations: Business Information Systems, Faculty of Computing and Media, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hoffert, F.D., Business Information Systems, Faculty of Computing and Media, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This research focuses on the possibility of automating a small flying drone with any programming language, so that it could follow and perform instructions such as navigating to a point, hovering, taking media and returning to its base. Programming a drone could be useful in many tasks, such as traffic surveillance, crowd control and unmanned investigations. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Computer programming languages; Drones; Mathematical programming; Crowd control; Javascript; Low costs; Research focus; Traffic surveillance; Unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV)
